items.title: Notre Dame Football: Marcus Freeman updates the media ahead of Boise State
items.summary: The Notre Dame Fighting Irish are back home this weekend as they play host to the Boise State Broncos in a GREEN OUT game. The Irish are currently ranked #21 with a 2-2 record, while the Broncos are unranked with a 3-1 record. On Thursday, Marcus Freeman gave the media a few updates… INJURY REPORT […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football: Hot and Cold Takes VS Boise State Broncos
items.summary: How’d We Do Last Week? Most Interesting I mean just look at this beautiful Italian Marcello Freemoni……It is definitely someone I would NOT like to cross. items.title: From Calculus to College Football: Wisdom That Lasts
items.summary: This weekend, Notre Dame faces the Boise State Broncos for the first time in history. There’s a special weight to those “firsts” — because they aren’t just another Saturday on the schedule, they’re a chance to write a new chapter in the story of Notre Dame football. For Boise State, it’s an opportunity to measure […]

items.title: Does Notre Dame just need to be 10-2 to make the college football playoff?
items.summary: Welcome to SB Nation Reacts, a survey of fans across the NCAA. Throughout the year we ask questions of the most plugged-in Notre Dame fans and fans across the country. Sign up here to participate in the weekly emailed surveys. A big argument started to brew Saturday night after the dust of the college football […]

items.title: 2025 Notre Dame Football: Irish VS Boise State Broncos
items.summary: It’s playoff football for Notre Dame from now until they lose. It actually started two weeks ago against Purdue, and followed them to Fayettville versus the Arkansas Razorbacks. The Irish passed those tests by a combined score of 112-43. The next hurdle for Notre Dame is the Boise State Broncos. Ideally the Irish could have […]

items.title: Notre Dame head coach Marcus Freeman isn’t having fun
items.summary: On Monday, Notre Dame Football head coach Marcus Freeman, got in front of the media for his weekly press conference. After two blowout wins in a row after the 0-2 start, the Irish look a little different. Most of that difference is on the defensive side of the ball — especially with Adon Shuler and […]
